title: Stooge Cycles MK7 Comes in Three Sizes, Bigger Tires, and Two Colors
content:
A proper modern klunker, loved by Morgan, the Stooge Cycles all-new MK7 (£ 820 frame and fork) was announced on the brand’s Instagram last Friday, and is in stock now at Stooge Cycles. These updated frames feature two colors and three sizes…

Stooge MK7 Quick Hits

  • £ 820 frame and fork
  • 3 all-new sizes: 16″ (S/M) with 610 ETT, 18″ (M/L) with 625 ETT and 20″ (XL) with 645mm ETT
  • Rack mounts on the rear triangle and fork.
  • Triple cage mounts on the fork and downtube.
  • Designed primarily around 29, this will also run well with 27.5+
  • Seatpost size – 31.6 mm. Minimum insertion required of 150mm.
  • Hub sizes – Rear 12×148, Front 15 x 110
  • Headset – 1 1/8″
  • BB standard is 73mm threaded

Geometry and Tire Size

Like the Dirt Tracker, the MK7 geometry features a 66º head angle and 65 mm of fork offset, allowing the steering geometry to remain relatively consistent, providing a predictable handling characteristic typically found in high trail bikes.

The MK7 is designed primarily around 29er wheels but the steel frame and fork will also run well with 27.5+. For best results in 29er mode, the MK7 is intended to run a 3″ or 3.25″ front tire and a 2.6″ or 2.8″ on the rear, offering more of a bulldozer feel with increased ride damping from the larger tire.
